intro: Leucosinapis alba, commonly known as the white clover, is a flowering plant in the legume family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. Leucosinapis alba is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it an important plant in soil enrichment.
